text: Hello everyone.
It's our final day in the 20-day phrasal verb challenge.
I hope you've enjoyed this experience.
And I certainly hope you feel comfortable
using the phrasal verbs we've studied together.
Now you know that progress is easy to make
when you set realistic goals.
And I hope you will not shy away from future language challenges.
What does this phrasal verb mean?
Do you recall the stress pattern for this kind of phrasal verb?
We stress the verb and the first particle.
Listen again.
We've heard this pattern before with other phrasal verbs.
For example...
Is there anything you shied away from in the past,
but can face now?
In this final review, I'll go over the phrasal verbs with you
from Days 11-20.
I have a text to share in three parts.
In this first part, only three phrasal verbs are needed.
Answer:
In this next part, all four phrasal verbs will be used.
Answer.
And here's our last part.
All three phrasal verbs will be used once.
Answer:
That's all for now, and that's the end of our 20-day phrasal verb challenge.
Thanks for watching. Happy studies!
